oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High-Tech Communication With Your Colleagues: Fax, Computer-Fax, BBS, and e-mail
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ehrlich, Jim
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: practitioners
Electronic communication
system
fax machines
Computer Fax
BBS systems
Data Modems
E-Mail
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: If you don't talk shop with your colleagues you will petrify. We've all seen practitioners isolated in their practices (or their ivory tower University offices) becoming progressively less valuable to their clients while losing all joy in veterinary medicine, until they end up burned out and whining about the competition from the feed store. Electronic communication can help,making it vastly more convenient to communicate with people in the next town or around the world. Unfortunately the number of options available make choosing a system, and getting it functioning, viciously complicated. Once you do get things working, though, you won't know how you got on before.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1993; 197-199
